intro: Tetradymia linearis, commonly known as the linear tetradyne, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue to purple flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Tetradymia linearis is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It is considered a perennial herb and is sometimes used in native plant gardens for its ecological and ornamental value.
